content.description: Start with left hand on the arete and right hand on a crimp. Move up to the lip of the boulder and traverse up to the obvious juggy finish via fun, dynamic moves. Same Finish as Long Live the Tank
content.location: Sit start on the left arete of the boulder's south face.

content.description: A strenuous lowball on good holds. Start with left hand on the lowest crimp above the overhang and right hand pinching the arete. There is a good foot under the overhang and a heel on the arete may or may not help. Continue up using the arete on the right and face holds on the left. Short but sweet.
content.location: Located on the short boulder just to the south of the main split face boulder.

content.description: Starts delicate and finishes powerful. Stand start with left hand on obvious rail and right hand on sidepull. Move left along the rail on delicate feet to reach a good hold low on the lip of the boulder. Make a dynamic move to a finish jug above. Excellent movement from start to finish on very satisfying holds. Same finish as One For the Road
content.location: Stand start in center of south face. Left hand on rail, right hand on sidepull.

content.description: Same start as Long Live the Tank. Move rightÂ from the start toward the left leaning undercling rail, gain the lip of the boulder and finish on the very sharp horn feature.
content.location: Start in the center of the south face. Left hand on rail and right hand on sidepull.

content.description: A fun slab problem with committing moves up the North Face of the boulder. Will get better with a little more cleaning
content.location: Look for a featured, low angle slab on the north face, stand start.

content.description: Overhanging start on the juggy horn that makes up the right most point of the south face. Move left to follow the lip up and to the left. Same finish as High Road. Fun, juggy lip traverse.
content.location: Right most point on the south face of the main boulder.

content.description: This boulder is directly off the road and has a pretty much non-existent approach. It is comprised of fine grained granite and relatively featured, making for high-quality moderate boulder problems. It is heavily shaded by the surrounding forest and while only 30 feet from the road, the foliage blocks it from view.
